examples: can't swim and dreads the water

definition: to feel extreme reluctance to meet or face
examples: dread the thought of speaking in public

definition: great fear especially in the face of impending evil
examples: were filled with dread by reports of another terrorist attack

definition: extreme uneasiness in the face of a disagreeable prospect (see prospect entry 1 sense 4c)

examples: the days of wooden ships and wooden homes, when fire was an omnipresent dread
